sen.j: 西洞院家（にしのとういんけ）は平高棟・平氏の流れをくむ公家。
sen.e: The Nishinotoin family is the kuge (court noble) originated from TAIRA no Takamune, the Taira clan,
The Nishinotoin family were kuge (court nobles) drawn from the lineage of TAIRA no Takamune of the Taira clan.
The Nishinotoin was a Kuge (court noble) family descended from TAIRA no Takamune of the Taira clan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 平高棟から17世の孫にあたる南北朝時代の西洞院行時（正三位・参議）（1324年 - 1369年）を祖とする堂上家。
sen.e: It was Tosho-ke (the hereditary lineage of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks) founded by Yukitoki NISHINOTOIN (Sangi (councilor) in Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank)) (1324-1369) in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), who was the 17th grandchild of TAIRA no Takamori.

The Nishinotoin family were Tosho-ke Court (nobles occupying relatively high ranks) originating with Yukitoki NISHINOTOIN (Sangi (councilor) Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank)) (1324-1369) in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), who was 17 generations away from TAIRA no Takamune.

The Nishinotoin was a family of dojo kuge (nobles occupying relatively high ranks) of which the founder was Yukitoki NISHINOTOIN (Sangi (councilor) of Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank)) (1324-1369) in the Northern and Southern Court period, who was 17 generations after TAIRA no Takamune.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。Courts →Courtに変更しました。

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)の西洞院時当（ときまさ）（従三位・兵衛府）（1531年 - 1566年）の代で中絶。
sen.e: It was interrupted in the generation of Tokimasa NISHINOTOIN (Hyoe-fu (Headquarters of the Middle Palace Guards) in Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank)) (1531-1566) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).

The family was discontinued in the generation of Tokimasa NISHINOTOIN (Hyoe-fu (Headquarters of the Middle Palace Guards) Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank)) (1531-1566) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).

The family was discontinued in the generation of Tokimasa NISHINOTOIN (Sahyoenokami (a leader of the Headquarters of the Middle Palace Guards) of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank)) (1531-1566) in the Sengoku Period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: その後河鰭家（かわばたけ）から西洞院時慶（従二位・参議）（1552年 - 1640年）が入り、更に西洞院時慶の子供からは平松家、長谷家、交野家が分かれ出る。
sen.e: After that, Tokiyoshi NISHINOTOIN (Sangi (councilor) in Junii (Junior Second Rank))(1552-1640) entered from the Kawabata family and furthermore, his children founded branch houses of the Hiramatsu family, the Hase family and the Katano family.

Thereafter, Tokiyoshi NISHINOTOIN (Sangi (councilor) Junii (Junior Second Rank))(1552-1640) joined the NISHINOTOIN family from the Kawabata family and his children founded the Hiramatsu, Hase and Katano branch families.
sen.cmt: It is not really clear what happened here. Did Tokiyoshi revive the NISHINOTONI name?
sen.e: Thereafter, Tokiyoshi NISHINOTOIN (Sangi (councilor) of Junii (Junior Second Rank)) (1552-1640) was adopted into the Nishinotoin family from the Kawabata family and his children founded branch families of the Hiramatsu, Hase and Katano.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 家格は半家_(公家)、大納言となった西洞院時成（1645年 - 1724年）及び中納言となった西洞院信堅（1804年 - 1891年）を除き、歴代当主の極官は従二位・参議であった。
sen.e: The social standing was hange (kuge), kuge of lower rank, and the kyokkan (the most highest rank which one was appointed) of successive head was Sangi in Junii except Tokinari NISHINOTOIN (1645-1724) who was assigned to Dainagon (Major Counselor) and Nobukata NISHINOTOIN (1804-1891) who was assigned to Chunagon (middle counselor).

The NISHINOTOIN family was now hange (kuge of lower rank), and, besides Tokinari NISHINOTOIN (1645-1724) who became Dainagon (Major Counselor) and Nobukata NISHINOTOIN (1804-1891) who became Chunagon (middle counselor), the highest office achieved by any of the family heads was Sangi (councilor) in Junii (Junior Second Rank).

The Nishinotoin family was in the rank of hange (the lowest of dojo kuge), and, besides Tokinari NISHINOTOIN (1645-1724) who became Dainagon (chief councilor of state) and Nobukata NISHINOTOIN (1804-1891) who became Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), the highest office held by the hereditary family heads was Sangi (councilor) of Junii (Junior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。Dainagon (Major Counselor)→Dainagon (chief councilor of state)に変更しました。Chunagon (middle counselor),→Chunagon (vice-councilor of state)に変更しました。

sen.j: 極官は参議止まりであったが、西洞院家の女子の多くは後宮に勤め、歴代の当主の多くは日記を記しており、当時の公家社会の様子を知る手がかりとなっている。
sen.e: Although its kyokkan was Sangi, many women of the Nishinotoin family worked for kokyu (empress's residence) and many successive heads left diaries, which are the clues to know the kuge society in those days.

Although the highest office achieved was Sangi, many women of the Nishinotoin family worked in the kokyu (empress's residence) and many generations of the family heads left diaries, which have provided clues about kuge society through the ages.

Although the highest office achieved was Sangi, many women of the Nishinotoin family worked in the kokyu (empress's residence) and many generations of the family heads left diaries, valuable records of kuge society in each generation.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 江戸時代の家禄は273石、後に260石。
sen.e: Karoku (hereditary stipend) in the Edo period was 273 goku crop yields, and 260 goku in later age.
The hereditary stipend of the family in the Edo period was 273 koku, and latterly 260 koku.
The hereditary stipend of the family in the Edo period was 273 koku of rice and later reduced to 260 koku.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.e: It was assigned to viscount after the Meiji period.
From the Meiji period onwards, the family held the title of viscount.
From the Meiji period onwards, the title of viscount was bestowed on the family.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。
